Peaceful relaxation of tension in Korea hoped for
articles.content:
Peaceful relaxation of tension in Korea hoped for 
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA)-- Sheikh Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, King of Bahrain, hoped that the tense situation of the Korean Peninsula would be relaxed peacefully by means of dialogue and negotiation.
 New DPRK ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary Kim Hyong Jun presented his credentials to him on July 22.    
 The King wished the Korean people success in their work for peaceful reunification of the country and economic progress. He expressed the hope that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop into closer and firmer relations.

Delegation of South Korean Jongyojo here
articles.content:
Delegation of South Korean Jongyojo here 
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Teachers Union of South Korea (Jongyojo) headed by vice-chairman Jo Hui Ju arrived here today on the invitation of the central committee of the Korean Educational and Cultural Workers' Trade Union.
 It was greeted at the airport by officials concerned with compatriotic feelings.    
 A working woman gave a bouquet to the head of the delegation.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from foreigners
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from foreigners 
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by Vladimir Tolstikov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, and Humberto Ortiz, honorary manager of the Voluntad Publishing House of Ecuador, on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
 The chairman of the Russian association handed the gift to the DPRK ambassador to Russia.

articles.title: Greetings to Moroccan King
articles.content:
Greetings to Moroccan King
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Moroccan King Mohamed Vi today on the occasion of its National Day.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in conformity with their mutual interests, the message wished the king and the Moroccan people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Friendship gathering held
articles.content:
Friendship gathering held
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A friendship gathering was held at the People's Palace of Culture today on the occasion of the National Day of the Kingdom of Belgium.
 Present on invitation were members of the friendship visiting group of the Belgian Labour Party led by Bossuyt Jozef, member of the central committee of the party, on a visit to the DPRK.    
 Its participants underscored the need to further develop the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from African guest
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from African guest
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A gift was presented to leader Kim Jong Il by Mohamed Dioue Fofana, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on a visit to the DPRK.
 The secretary general handed the gift to an official concerned.

articles.title: Mongolian parliamentary delegation here
articles.content:
Mongolian parliamentary delegation here
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State Great Hural of Mongolia led by S. Gungaadorj, chairman of the standing committee on Environment and Rural Development of the State Great Hural, arrived here today.
 It was met at the airport by deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly Jo Gyu Il who is chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Parliamentary Group and Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK Janchivdorjyn Lombo.
